name: Cacio e Pepe Corn on the Cob
description: Cacio e pepe is a traditional Italian pasta made with pecorino, Parmesan, black pepper and a little pasta cooking water. These cobs borrow the flavors of the traditional dish, but the cheese sauce is not thinned with water, so it’s very rich and creamy. Serve the cacio e pepe corn with grilled steak or fish and a green salad with acidic dressing. You’ll be happy.
keywords: appetizer, side dish, black pepper, butter, corn, parmesan, pecorino, summer
recipeIngredient: 4 tablespoons unsalted butter, at room temperature

recipeInstructions.text: Heat your grill to medium-high. Grill corn, turning occasionally, until cooked through and lightly charred, 10 to 12 minutes. (Alternatively, add corn to a large pot of salted boiling water and cook for 5 to 7 minutes.)
Meanwhile, in a small bowl, mix together butter, half the Parmesan, half the pecorino, and a couple grinds of black pepper.
Slather hot corn with the cheesy butter. Sprinkle with the remaining cheese and top each with a little more black pepper.
